title: Jet2 flight from Malaga to Edinburgh airport declares mid-air emergency
text:
A Jet2 flight from Malaga to Edinburgh airport declared a mid-air emergency today - just 11 minutes away from the Scottish capital.

The LS858 flight was just moments away from landing when it suddenly declared the emergency.

But it later landed safely just before 2.20pm, around the time it had been originally scheduled to land.

It is not clear what the emergency is. MailOnline has contacted Jet2 for comment

It is not clear what the emergency is. MailOnline has contacted Jet2 for comment.

It comes after a polio vaccine spill on a KLM jet sparked an evacuation of part of Glasgow airport today as the fire brigade mopped up the leak.

At least 20 fire service personnel dealt with the package along with the police and ambulance services.

People in the international area of the airport were cleared out by police and the jet - which had arrived from Amsterdam - was cordoned off.

The M8 exit slip road leading to the transport hub was also been closed off, Traffic Scotland said.
description: The flight was due to land at Edinburgh Airport at 2.15pm. It is not clear what the emergency is.
